name: Sundarbans
title: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
description: The Sundarbans, the largest mangrove forest in the world, is a UNESCO World Heritage site, home to the Bengal tiger and various wildlife.

name: Cox's Bazar
title: Cox's Bazar Sea Beach
description: Cox's Bazar boasts the longest unbroken sandy sea beach in the world, stretching over 120 kilometers, ideal for relaxation and adventure.

name: Saint Martin's Island
title: Saint Martin's Coral Island
description: A serene tropical paradise, Saint Martin's Island is Bangladesh's only coral island, known for its crystal-clear waters and coral reefs.

name: Bandarban
title: Bandarban Hill Tracts
description: Bandarban offers lush green hills, waterfalls, and the highest peaks in Bangladesh, making it a favorite for trekking and nature lovers.

name: Rangamati
title: Rangamati Lake City
description: Known as the 'Lake City', Rangamati is famous for its stunning Kaptai Lake, traditional tribal culture, and lush greenery.

name: Srimangal
title: Srimangal Tea Capital
description: Srimangal, the tea capital of Bangladesh, offers beautiful tea gardens, lush forests, and traditional Monipuri culture.
